item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, March 11, 2025 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Fastplotlib: GPU-accelerated, fast, and interactive plotting library (115 points | 15 comments)
2. Happy 20th Birthday, Y Combinator (206 points | 49 comments)
3. Show HN: Factorio Learning Environment – Agents Build Factories (442 points | 142 comments)
4. Mapping the University of Chicago's 135-Year Expansion into Hyde Park and Beyond (142 points | 39 comments)
5. Show HN: Krep a High-Performance String Search Utility Written in C (50 points | 24 comments)
6. Launch HN: Sift Dev (YC W25) – AI-Powered Datadog Alternative (10 points | 5 comments)
7. Backyard Cyanide (20 points | 3 comments)
8. NASA to launch space observatory that will map 450M galaxies (23 points | 7 comments)
9. Legion Health (YC S21) is hiring an AI/ML Engineer ( | hide)
10. NIST Selects HQC as Fifth Algorithm for Post-Quantum Encryption (63 points | 39 comments)
11. A 10x Faster TypeScript (831 points | 419 comments)
12. Show HN: Program Explorer, a container playground (21 points | 4 comments)
13. New tools for building agents (34 points | 8 comments)
14. Short Conversations with Poets: Dong Li (24 points | 3 comments)
15. Anomalous Ionization in the Central Molecular Zone by Sub-GeV Dark Matter (26 points | 6 comments)
16. Representing Type Lattices Compactly (60 points | 14 comments)
17. Show HN: Seven39, a social media app that is only open for 3 hours every evening (605 points | 289 comments)
18. Espressif's Response to Undocumented Commands in ESP32 Bluetooth by Tarlogic (20 points | 1 comment)
19. A unified acoustic-to-speech-to-language embedding space (14 points | discuss)
20. The US island that speaks Elizabethan English (86 points | 29 comments)
21. AI-Generated Voice Evidence Poses Dangers in Court (50 points | 28 comments)
22. Local Deep Research – ArXiv, wiki and other searches included (112 points | 17 comments)
23. Modern Baby: A pioneering computer from Manchester (33 points | 2 comments)
24. Kissing moons may explain why Earth's moon is so large (76 points | 23 comments)
25. Bending Spacetime in the Basement (1997) (204 points | 34 comments)
26. Sidekick: Local-first native macOS LLM app (228 points | 71 comments)
27. More mysterious DNS root query traffic from a large cloud/DNS operator (2022) (39 points | 6 comments)
28. Bel in Clojure (2022) (117 points | 5 comments)
29. What Makes Code Hard to Read: Visual Patterns of Complexity (2023) (173 points | 140 comments)
30. Neonatal fungi: lifelong metabolic health via macrophage β cell development (68 points | 8 comments)
